intro: Cycnium tubulosum subsp. montanum, commonly known as mountain hollow-stemmed morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, blooming in the morning. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, often found in rocky or disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural collections.
